Instrument.name: The Particulate Impact Analyzer (PIA) for Giotto
Instrument.description: The Particular Impact Analyser (PIA) on the Giotto spacecraft was a mass spectrometer operating on the time-of-fight principle. It included an adjustable, elliptic aperture, a 10 micron thick roll of platinum foil doped with 5% silver that could be unrolled across entrance aperture to expose new, clean target material as the dust count rate increased, four detectors - two partially exposed, two completely shielded, and a photomultiplier to sense the light pulse resulting from a particle impact.
